attributes.action: Stop discriminating workers with dyed hair, allow dyed hair at all workplaces
attributes.additional_details: Lots of employees are allowed to have tattoos, as they should do, but how is having a tattoo any different from having unnatural coloured hair?
attributes.background: Today I was sent home from my workplace because I had dyed my hair pink; I was told to come back to work when I had dyed my hair a natural colour. This is discrimation and is unfair, how does the colour of my hair affect my ability to work just like everyone else?

rejection.details:
At the moment, dress codes are the responsibility of each individual employer, rather than the Government or Parliament. 

You could start a new petition asking for a change in the law, so that - for example - employers would not be allowed to impose dress codes which dictate how their employees hair can look.
